text:
A documentary, based on the life of Pakistani teenage activist Malala Yousafzai, has won a BAFTA nomination in the best documentary category.

He Named Me Malala , by American filmmaker Davis Guggenheim, charts the life of the 18-year-old schoolgirl, who was shot in the head by the Taliban and airlifted for surgery in the U.K. in 2012. Malala’s life story will go head to head with another life story, that of British singer-songwriter Amy Winehouse, by Indian-origin British film-maker Asif Kapadia.

Amy competes in the documentary category as well as in the outstanding British film category. The film traces the Grammy Award-winning soul singer’s life and her death as a result of a drug overdose. — PTI
title: Malala and Amy Winehouse documentaries nominated
